summary: Static freight management website with multiple freight-related service offerings and four pages (Home, About Us, Services, Contact Us).
architectural_notes: Hero section should only use the ship-with-containers background image; remove the additional right-side hero image (freight-hero.dim_1920x800.png).
Ensure text over hero/background images meets accessible contrast (adjust overlay/text colors as needed so text is not hidden).
Shipment tracking page should present as 'Coming soon' with disabled submit button until tracking is implemented.
Hero headline, supporting paragraph, and stats labels on the ship-with-containers hero background should use a light/white text color to maintain contrast against the image.

Frontend project should be runnable locally: ensure frontend/package.json contains proper Vite (and app) dependencies and standard scripts (dev/build/preview), so `pnpm install` + `pnpm run dev` works on a fresh download.
Ensure frontend/package.json includes all actual app dependencies referenced in code (e.g., @tanstack/react-query and any router libs) so imports resolve and `pnpm run dev` works.

Blank page likely caused by `frontend/src/main.tsx` rendering nothing: `ReactDOM.createRoot(...).render()` is missing its JSX tree (e.g., `<React.StrictMode><QueryClientProvider client={queryClient}><App /></QueryClientProvider></React.StrictMode>`). Ensure `main.tsx` mounts `<App />` (and providers) into `#root`.
Do not publish/deploy to production without explicit user confirmation; prefer draft/preview until approved.
known_issues: An extra hero image (freight-hero.dim_1920x800.png) is appearing on the right side and should be removed (user chose option 1).
Text on the background image is hard to read/hidden due to insufficient color contrast and needs correction.
Hero section headline/paragraph/stats text is not readable against the background; set to white/light (and/or adjust overlay) for sufficient contrast.
Downloaded project’s frontend/package.json appears incomplete/incorrect for local dev (no/incorrect scripts or missing Vite dependency), causing `pnpm run dev` / `vite` command failures on Windows.

Local dev build fails due to missing dependency/import for `@tanstack/react-query` (error at `import { QueryClient, QueryClientProvider } from "@tanstack/react-query";`), indicating package.json dependencies are incomplete/out of sync with code.

Local app shows a blank page because `frontend/src/main.tsx` calls `ReactDOM.createRoot(...).render()` with no React element tree; nothing is mounted to `#root` (should at least render `<App />`, optionally wrapped in `QueryClientProvider`).
Site was published to production (Version 8) but user does not want a live deployment; needs rollback/unpublish.

existing_features.title: Create a static marketing website for a freight management company with four pages: Home, About Us, Services, and Contact Us.
Implement a consistent site layout (header with navigation, main content area, footer) shared across all pages.
Home page: include a hero section, trust/credibility highlights, and call-to-action sections that direct users to Services and Contact Us.
About Us page: provide company overview content sections (mission, values, what makes the company different) and a simple timeline or stats strip.
Services page: showcase many freight-related services as clearly structured categories with service cards and brief descriptions.
Contact Us page: include a static contact form with client-side validation and a non-sending submission experience (e.g., success message) plus visible company contact details.
Apply a coherent visual theme across the site (color palette, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a freight/logistics brand; avoid a blue/purple default look.
Add static image assets (generated) for branding and page visuals, and render them from the frontend public assets folder.
Generate a new background image featuring a cargo ship with stacked containers that matches the current freight/logistics visual vibe, and add it to the app’s static assets.

Apply the new ship-with-containers background image behind the primary hero area (and any other relevant top-of-page sections as appropriate) using a readable overlay so headings, buttons, and navigation remain accessible and high-contrast in both light and dark themes.
Implement a shipment tracking system that allows a user to enter a tracking number and view shipment details and status events.

Remove the additional hero-side image shown in the Home page hero section so only the background image remains (keep the existing ship-container background and overlay). Specifically, remove the right-side large image that uses "/assets/generated/freight-hero.dim_1920x800.png" from the hero layout.

Fix the readability of text rendered on top of the ship-container hero background image by increasing contrast in both light and dark themes (e.g., adjust overlay strength and/or apply appropriate high-contrast text utility classes), so hero headings, supporting paragraph, and stats labels are not hidden by their color against the background.
Update the Shipment Tracking page to a 'Coming soon' placeholder: disable the submit/Track button and display a clear "Coming soon" message indicating the feature is not yet available.

Update the Home page hero section text styling so the hero headline, supporting paragraph, and the three hero stats labels ("Years Experience", "Countries Served", "Shipments/Year") render in a white or otherwise light color that remains readable on top of the ship-container background image.

Remove the duplicate React Query provider setup so the app uses a single `QueryClientProvider` instance (either in `frontend/src/main.tsx` or `frontend/src/App.tsx`), without changing user-facing functionality.

Ensure the app always mounts a React element tree to the #root element (render <App /> wrapped with the required providers) so the UI is not blank when running locally, even if a user’s downloaded copy of frontend/src/main.tsx contains an empty render() call.

Do not modify any files in the immutable frontend paths; if an entry-point change is required to guarantee mounting, implement it via a new entry module (e.g., a new src file) and update frontend/index.html to import that new entry module instead of editing frontend/src/main.tsx.

Add an app-wide “site disabled / maintenance mode” gate that, when enabled, prevents the marketing website UI (routes, header, footer, pages) from rendering and instead renders a single standalone screen indicating the app is offline/unpublished.

Implement the disabled/maintenance gate as a simple, explicit configuration mechanism that can be changed without touching immutable frontend paths (e.g., by toggling a single constant or reading a Vite environment variable in the non-immutable entry path currently used by the app: `frontend/src/entry.tsx`).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a static freight management website with four pages: Home, About Us, Services, Contact Us, showcasing many freight-related services.
Add a background image (ship with containers) behind relevant sections that matches the site’s visual vibe.
Add a shipment tracking system so users can track their shipment.
Update the shipment tracking page to a 'Coming soon' placeholder: disable the submit button and display messaging that the feature is coming soon.

Replace the incomplete `frontend/package.json` with a complete, valid package manifest for this React + TypeScript + Tailwind + TanStack Router + React Query frontend so that `pnpm install` installs all required dependencies (including Vite) and `pnpm run dev` starts the app successfully on Windows.

Restore or create a valid `frontend/package.json` (and any required lockfile updates) so that `pnpm install` installs all dependencies used by the current frontend source code, including `@tanstack/react-query` required by `frontend/src/main.tsx` and `frontend/src/App.tsx`.

Ensure the `frontend` dependency list is consistent with the actual imports in the codebase (at minimum: React, React DOM, Vite + React plugin, TypeScript, Tailwind/PostCSS tooling, `@tanstack/react-router`, `@tanstack/react-query`, `next-themes`, and the Internet Identity dependencies imported by `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts` such as `@dfinity/auth-client` and `@icp-sdk/core`).
Rollback/unpublish the production deployment and remove the live web app (user does not want it live).

projectName: Static Freight Management Website (Home, About, Services, Contact)
